pdgm.pdgmnote: Wedekind-etal2007 p. 123. The morphologically past form éefi,etc.,has present meaning.

Wedekind-etal2007 Table #29. There are two paradigms of say,-ni- and –di-. Presently,for most Beja dialects,the second paradigm is the most common one,while theother one has only survived with certain speakers and in certain forms.(p. 97)
Wedekind-etal2007 p. 123. The morphologically past form éefi,etc.,has present meaning.

Wedekind-etal2007 p. 156. The aux aha take and diya put with verb diliba trade yields respectively buy and sell.

Wedekind-etal2007 Table #29. There are two paradigms of say,-ni- and –di-. Presently,for most Beja dialects,the second paradigm is the most common one,while theother one has only survived with certain speakers and in certain forms.(p. 97)
Wedekind-etal2007 p. 123. The morphologically past form éefi,etc.,has present meaning.
Wedekind-etal2007 p. 154. V+a SAY = I want to V;V+1 SAY = I shall V.
